page.title: 06Staploe, Religion
page.content: In 1965, Local Government reorganization placed a county boundary between Staploe and St. Mary's Church, Eaton Socon, to whose parish it belongs. Distance makes frequent attendance difficult for the very young and the old. The administrative parish has two places of worship. The Methodist Chapel in Honeydon, built in 1872 for Â£92, is the smallest in the circuit,seating 50. Services are held once a month. A car scheme to bring the elderly from the other hamlets has increased the congregation. The Chapel has been refurbished inside and out. The pews were removed some years ago making it available for certain functions and meetings. Staploe has the last of 7 non-denominational Gospel Halls founded in 1880's. There are no longer services and it is under a trust.
